comment: Don't recommend online class, take in person. Discussion post weekly, which he graded hard & didn't give full credit unless you responded to 3 people but his syllabus says respond to 2. Had to do a ride along & write a paper about it, which was fun & easy. Lightened up by the end of the semester. Nice guy in person but the opposite for online class

Dr. McFarlane's course was somewhat challenging because of the amount of work each week (a lot of reading, one long test with essay questions and essay-like DB posts). However, the material isn't too challenging. He is also very helpful if you fall behind or need guidance. I took him for an elective but actually ended up learning a lot.

This online class was great. Very few discussion boards, and it wasn't mandatory to reply to other students. However, once the discussion board was done, it disappeared, so I highly suggest saving all your discussion boards in a word document (they'll come in handy later). The tests were 4-6 questions that you'd have all week to work on.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Took Professor McFarlane for Criminal Investigation and I'd recommend that you do the same if you need a GPA boost. Attendance is not mandatory and EVERYTHING was online except for one or two in-class discussions. By the end of the semester, maybe 1/3 of the class showed up consistently and some days he only lectured for 30 minutes
He is by far the best professor ive taken at KSU! He is very understanding, explains lectures well, very respectful and cares about his students! You will not regret taking him!
Great professor. Very helpful makes it very clear, take he is awesome!
